problems.title: Longest Continuous Subarray With Absolute Diff Less Than or Equal to Limit (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer limit, return the size of the longest non-empty subarray such that the absolute difference between any two elements of this subarray is less than or equal to limit.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and limit.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the size of the longest subarray.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 4
8 2 4 7

Sample Output
2

Explanation: [8] (diff 0), [2,4] (diff 2), [4,7] (diff 3), [7] (diff 0). Longest is 2.
hintsList: Use two monotonic deques: one to keep track of the maximum and one for the minimum in the current window.
If max - min > limit, shrink the window from the left.
